verses.text: To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven:

similars.text: Yea, all things which come of the earth, in the season thereof, are made for the benefit and the use of man, both to please the eye and to gladden the heart;

verses.text: A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted;

similars.text: A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;

verses.text: A time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up;

similars.text: A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace.

verses.text: A time to weep, and a time to laugh; a time to mourn, and a time to dance;

similars.text: Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to heaviness.
A time to be born, and a time to die; a time to plant, and a time to pluck up that which is planted;

verses.text: A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;

similars.text: A time to get, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away;
A time to get, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away;
A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;

verses.text: A time to get, and a time to lose; a time to keep, and a time to cast away;

similars.text: A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;
A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;

verses.text: A time to rend, and a time to sew; a time to keep silence, and a time to speak;

similars.text: A time to cast away stones, and a time to gather stones together; a time to embrace, and a time to refrain from embracing;

verses.text: A time to love, and a time to hate; a time of war, and a time of peace.

similars.text: A time to kill, and a time to heal; a time to break down, and a time to build up;

verses.text: What profit hath he that worketh in that wherein he laboureth?

similars.text: What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under the sun?
What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under the sun?

verses.text: I have seen the travail, which God hath given to the sons of men to be exercised in it.

similars.text: And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail hath God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.

Verily, verily, I say unto you, that when I give a commandment to any of the sons of men to do a work unto my name, and those sons of men go with all their might and with all they have to perform that work, and cease not their diligence, and their enemies come upon them and hinder them from performing that work, behold, it behooveth me to require that work no more at the hands of those sons of men, but to accept of their offerings.
And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail hath God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.

verses.text: He hath made every thing beautiful in his time: also he hath set the world in their heart, so that no man can find out the work that God maketh from the beginning to the end.

similars.text: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heavens by his discretion.
He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heaven by his understanding.

verses.text: I know that there is no good in them, but for a man to rejoice, and to do good in his life.
And also that every man should eat and drink, and enjoy the good of all his labour, it is the gift of God.

similars.text: There is nothing better for a man, than that he should eat and drink, and that he should make his soul enjoy good in his labour. This also I saw, that it was from the hand of God.
Every man also to whom God hath given riches and wealth, and hath given him power to eat thereof, and to take his portion, and to rejoice in his labour; this is the gift of God.

Behold that which I have seen: it is good and comely for one to eat and to drink, and to enjoy the good of all his labour that he taketh under the sun all the days of his life, which God giveth him: for it is his portion.
Every man shall give as he is able, according to the blessing of the Lord thy God which he hath given thee.
There is nothing better for a man, than that he should eat and drink, and that he should make his soul enjoy good in his labour. This also I saw, that it was from the hand of God.
Every man also to whom God hath given riches and wealth, and hath given him power to eat thereof, and to take his portion, and to rejoice in his labour; this is the gift of God.

Behold that which I have seen: it is good and comely for one to eat and to drink, and to enjoy the good of all his labour that he taketh under the sun all the days of his life, which God giveth him: for it is his portion.

verses.text: I know that, whatsoever God doeth, it shall be for ever: nothing can be put to it, nor any thing taken from it: and God doeth it, that men should fear before him.

similars.text: For with God nothing shall be impossible.
There shall no man be able to stand before you: for the Lord your God shall lay the fear of you and the dread of you upon all the land that ye shall tread upon, as he hath said unto you.
There shall not any man be able to stand before thee all the days of thy life: as I was with Moses, so I will be with thee: I will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.
And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God; for they shall wisely consider of his doing.
And he that killeth any man shall surely be put to death.

verses.text: That which hath been is now; and that which is to be hath already been; and God requireth that which is past.

similars.text: The thing that hath been, it is that which shall be; and that which is done is that which shall be done: and there is no new thing under the sun.
Write the things which thou hast seen, and the things which are, and the things which shall be hereafter;

For ask now of the days that are past, which were before thee, since the day that God created man upon the earth, and ask from the one side of heaven unto the other, whether there hath been any such thing as this great thing is, or hath been heard like it?
Write the works of this people, which shall be, even as hath been written, of that which hath been.

verses.text: And moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment, that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness, that iniquity was there.
I said in mine heart, God shall judge the righteous and the wicked: for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.

similars.text: For I, the Lord, will judge all men according to their works, according to the desire of their hearts.
The Lord shall judge the people: judge me, O Lord, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.
He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor with judgment.
And ye ought to say in your hearts--let God judge between me and thee, and reward thee according to thy deeds.
For in mine own due time will I come upon the earth in judgment, and my people shall be redeemed and shall reign with me on earth.
For God shall bring every work into judgment, with every secret thing, whether it be good, or whether it be evil.
But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.
For God shall bring every work into judgment, with every secret thing, whether it be good, or whether it be evil.
For there is a time appointed for every man, according as his works shall be.

verses.text: I said in mine heart concerning the estate of the sons of men, that God might manifest them, and that they might see that they themselves are beasts.

similars.text: For the earnest expectation of the creature waiteth for the manifestation of the sons of God.

And in that day that they shall exercise faith in me, saith the Lord, even as the brother of Jared did, that they may become sanctified in me, then will I manifest unto them the things which the brother of Jared saw, even to the unfolding unto them all my revelations, saith Jesus Christ, the Son of God, the Father of the heavens and of the earth, and all things that in them are.

verses.text: For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.

similars.text: When thou with rebukes dost correct man for iniquity, thou makest his beauty to consume away like a moth: surely every man is vanity. Selah.

There is a vanity which is done upon the earth; that there be just men, unto whom it happeneth according to the work of the wicked; again, there be wicked men, to whom it happeneth according to the work of the righteous: I said that this also is vanity.
Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male and his female: and of beasts that are not clean by two, the male and his female.

verses.text: All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.

similars.text: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.
All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.

verses.text: Who knoweth the spirit of man that goeth upward, and the spirit of the beast that goeth downward to the earth?

similars.text: For what man knoweth the things of a man, save the spirit of man which is in him? even so the things of God knoweth no man, but the Spirit of God.

The beast that thou sawest was, and is not; and shall ascend out of the bottomless pit, and go into perdition: and they that dwell on the earth shall wonder, whose names were not written in the book of life from the foundation of the world, when they behold the beast that was, and is not, and yet is.

verses.text: Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?

similars.text: And it is requisite with the justice of God that men should be judged according to their works; and if their works were good in this life, and the desires of their hearts were good, that they should also, at the last day, be restored unto that which is good.
That the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.
He shall see the travail of his soul, and shall be satisfied; by his knowledge shall my righteous servant justify many; for he shall bear their iniquities.
For I, the Lord, will judge all men according to their works, according to the desire of their hearts.
